post.body: Ooo! I have that one to look forward to. I'm a bit behind!
Yeh, *that's* cold. Even when I lived in Montana it rarely went below -15C.
Radiolab is my favorite podcast. I love the interplay between Jad and Robert, and it's intellectually very stimulating.
I once got into listening to Bing and the Andrews Sisters doing Xmas music - but that was in July and thus safely ironic.
Pastebud only works between Safari/Mail, but you can use Twittermail to post a tweet.
By golly, it did work! It'll be handy in combination with Pastebud.
Tweeting from twittermail. I'll see soon whether it worked.
Just got a message: "Santa Claus (@SantaClaus25) is now following your updates on Twitter." Checking whether my tweets are naughty or nice?
time up at the baby gym. Now some shopping for supplies to get us through the storm.
Now that is good Xmas music: RT @dporter I often listen to the Vince Guaraldi Trio stuff at home - http://tinyurl.com/7otkzu
Frank Rich is on good form today: http://tinyurl.com/7cngt9
Holy crap. It's forecast to be -17Â°C with the wind chill tomorrow.
With the ubiquity of Xmas music in public places is there *anyone* who listens to it at home? Is it purely a public thing?
Wife thinks me saying she dragged me to the baby gym makes her look bad, but she dragged me to s.t. good so I think it makes her look good.
Only two kids at the baby gym, so it's actually quite pleasant.
In the baby gym, listening to Bing and Bowie singing the Little Drummer Boy.
Dragged out to a baby gym by my wife. First thing that happens is that Maia locks herself in the bathroom. Snow storm starting. What next?
Maia says "baidand" instead of bandaid. It's so cute. Also insisting on "ice" for every booboo. Oh, and she's much better today.
Jeez! Another 8 to 20 inches forecast for my area today.
Just been playing with Pastebud. Works like a charm.
